item.title: Back up Notion? Yes, you can.
item.description: With our new Notion integration, plakar can now snapshot and restore workspaces directly — docs, databases, and more. No hacks. Just data.

item.title: go-kloset-sdk is live !
item.description: want to craft a ptar archive but you don’t need a full-fledged backup solution ? here comes kapsul, our ptar-specific tool, providing all you need from building to restoring and inspecting.

item.title: Introducing go-cdc-chunkers: chunk and deduplicate everything
item.description: We released go-cdc-chunkers, our open source library to provide Content-Defined Chunking. Here’s why deduplication is important.

item.title: Kapsul: a tool to create and manage deduplicated, compressed and encrypted PTAR vaults
item.description: want to craft a ptar archive but you don’t need a full-fledged backup solution ? here comes kapsul, our ptar-specific tool, providing all you need from building to restoring and inspecting.

item.title: Technical deep dive into .ptar: replacing .tgz for petabyte-scale S3 archives
item.description: .tgz made sense in 1994, but today we need archiving that supports deduplication, encryption, S3, and zero trust. here’s why we built .ptar.

item.title: It doesn't make sense to wrap modern data in a 1979 format, introducing .ptar
item.description: .ptar is our own archive format, a self-contained kloset, a container for your data. You end up with a standalone file that provides deduplication, compression, encryption, with all of the fancy features of a kloset store !

item.title: Plakar v1.0.2 was released: mostly S3 improvements !
item.description: Plakar v1.0.2 adds an automatic security check for new critical releases. It also fixes relative-path resolution when using an agent, plus delivers dramatic S3 performance and memory improvements for faster, more reliable backups.
